item.content:encoded: Graphic: William Joel/Polygon | Source images: Western Digital/Seagate/Microsoft Some recommendations to add more storage for Xbox games Storage space inside our consoles is at an absolute premium these days. Even though the Xbox Series X ships with 1 TB of built-in storage (the Series S has just 512 GB, unless you pre-order the 1 TB carbon black version coming in Sept.), you may be amazed ‚Äî no, terrified ‚Äî by how quickly that space can get gobbled up by games, updates, apps, and saves. Game P...

item.content:encoded: Image: Singularity Six A cozy take on MMOs that elevates the genre Cozy games have grown in popularity, and life simulators have gone from a rare treat to a much more populated genre. Palia, an upcoming game from Singularity Six, is a cheerful cottagecore MMO that takes a few comfy, chill gameplay loops and combines them into a delightful package. During the preview period offered to press, I have completed Palia‚Äôs first leg of content, graduating from copper to iron and venturing into the gam...

item.description: Image: Telltale Games Welcome back, beltalowda It‚Äôs been over a year since the TV series The Expanse ended with a compressed sixth season. While it‚Äôs a miracle it managed to cover six of the nine Ex...
item.content:encoded: Image: Telltale Games Welcome back, beltalowda It‚Äôs been over a year since the TV series The Expanse ended with a compressed sixth season. While it‚Äôs a miracle it managed to cover six of the nine Expanse novels during its run on SyFy and later Amazon Prime, it‚Äôs hard not to feel like we left that universe too soon. Nothing on television today quite compares to the hard sci-fi world-building and political allegory the show managed to thread on a weekly basis. Thankfully, The Expanse: A Telltale...

item.description: "This Week in AI" on KDnuggets provides a weekly roundup of the latest happenings in the world of Artificial Intelligence. Covering a wide range of topics from recent headlines, scholarly articles, ed...
item.content:encoded: "This Week in AI" on KDnuggets provides a weekly roundup of the latest happenings in the world of Artificial Intelligence. Covering a wide range of topics from recent headlines, scholarly articles, educational resources, to spotlight research, the post is designed to keep readers up-to-date and informed about the ever-evolving field of AI.

item.title: Introducing OpenLLM: Open Source Library for LLMs | KDnuggets
item.description: A user-friendly platform for operating large language models (LLMs) in production, with features such as fine-tuning, serving, deployment, and monitoring of any LLMs.
item.content:encoded: A user-friendly platform for operating large language models (LLMs) in production, with features such as fine-tuning, serving, deployment, and monitoring of any LLMs.

item.title: NVIDIA's New AI: Text To Image Supercharged! | Two Minute Papers
Multivariate Time-Series Prediction with BQML | KDnuggets
item.description: Google's BQML can be used to make time series models, and recently it was updated to create multivariate time series models. With the simple code, this article shows how to use it to predict multivari...
item.content:encoded: Google's BQML can be used to make time series models, and recently it was updated to create multivariate time series models. With the simple code, this article shows how to use it to predict multivariate time series and it can be more powerful than a univariate time series model in this article.

item.description: Unlock the power of AI collaboration with Keras 3.0! Seamlessly switch between TensorFlow, JAX, and PyTorch, revolutionizing your deep learning projects. Read now and stay ahead in the world of AI.
item.content:encoded: Unlock the power of AI collaboration with Keras 3.0! Seamlessly switch between TensorFlow, JAX, and PyTorch, revolutionizing your deep learning projects. Read now and stay ahead in the world of AI.

item.title: RT-2: New model translates vision and language into action | DeepMind Blog
item.description: Introducing Robotic Transformer 2 (RT-2), a novel vision-language-action (VLA) model that learns from both web and robotics data, and translates this knowledge into generalised instructions for roboti...
item.content:encoded: Introducing Robotic Transformer 2 (RT-2), a novel vision-language-action (VLA) model that learns from both web and robotics data, and translates this knowledge into generalised instructions for robotic control, while retaining web-scale capabilities. This work builds upon Robotic Transformer 1 (RT-1), a model trained on multi-task demonstrations which can learn combinations of tasks and objects seen in the robotic data. RT-2 shows improved generalisation capabilities and semantic and visual unde...

item.description: Determining on the fly how much additional audio to process to resolve ambiguities increases accuracy while reducing latency relative to fixed-lookahead approaches.

item.title: In search of a generalizable method for source-free domain adaptation | Google AI Blog
item.description: Posted by Eleni Triantafillou, Research Scientist, and Malik Boudiaf, Student Researcher, Google Deep learning has recently made tremendous progress in a wide range of problems and applications, but m...
item.content:encoded: Posted by Eleni Triantafillou, Research Scientist, and Malik Boudiaf, Student Researcher, Google Deep learning has recently made tremendous progress in a wide range of problems and applications, but models often fail unpredictably when deployed in unseen domains or distributions. Source-free domain adaptation (SFDA) is an area of research that aims to design methods for adapting a pre-trained model (trained on a ‚Äúsource domain‚Äù) to a new ‚Äútarget domain‚Äù, using only unlabeled data from the latter...

item.description: Posted by Cat Armato, Program Manager, Google Groups across Google actively pursue research in the field of machine learning (ML), ranging from theory and application. We build ML systems to solve...
item.content:encoded: Posted by Cat Armato, Program Manager, Google Groups across Google actively pursue research in the field of machine learning (ML), ranging from theory and application. We build ML systems to solve deep scientific and engineering challenges in areas of language, music, visual processing, algorithm development, and more. We aim to build a more collaborative ecosystem with the broader ML research community through open-sourcing tools and datasets, publishing our work, and actively participating...

item.description: AI is a powerful technology that will transform our future, so how can we best apply it to help combat climate change and find sustainable solutions? The effects of climate change on Earth‚Äôs ecosystem...
item.content:encoded: AI is a powerful technology that will transform our future, so how can we best apply it to help combat climate change and find sustainable solutions? The effects of climate change on Earth‚Äôs ecosystems are incredibly complex, and as part of our effort to use AI for solving some of the world‚Äôs most challenging problems, here are some of the ways we‚Äôre working to advance our understanding, optimise existing systems, and accelerate breakthrough science of climate and its effects.

item.content:encoded: At this year‚Äôs ACL, Amazon researchers won an outstanding-paper award for showing that knowledge distillation using contrastive decoding in the teacher model and counterfactual reasoning in the student model improves the consistency of ‚Äúchain of thought‚Äù reasoning.

Because societal contexts by nature are dynamic, complex, non-linear, contested, subjective, and highly qualitative, they are challenging to translate i...
